bibl.title: Letter from Royal S. Webster to Philip Showalter Hench, September 26, 1940

div1.p: Webster makes some small corrections on Hench's sketch of Camp Lazear. He sends him various maps of Marianao.

div1.head: Letter from Royal S. Webster to Philip Showalter Hench, September 26, 1940
div1.opener:
FERROCARRILES UNIDOS DE LA HABANA
Y ALMACENES DE REGLA, LIMITADA
COMPAÑIA INTERNACIONAL
-----
VIAS Y OBRAS
---
HABANA, Sept- 26th, 1940.-
NUM.
Philip S. Hench M.D.
Mayo Clinic
102 - 110 Second Avenue S.W.
Rochester, Minn.
Dear doctor Hench:-
div1.p:
I am returning your sketch which I found correct
excepting that Quemados was a little out of place and al-
so the part of Marianao at the end of the line was known
as Samá.

I have checked up with our friend John J. Moran
as to the true location of “Camp Lazear” which he places
on the “San José” estate which fronts on the Calzada Real
de Marianao between Marianao and Ceiba at a point now
known as “Pogolotti”.

Mr. Moran certainly has reason to know where
“Camp Lazear” was located and I do not believe it possi-
ble that he be mistaken.

I am returning you another copy of the plan of
Marianao dated 1906 which was copied of an older plan on
which I have marked the “San José” estate.

Mr. Moran informs me that there was at the Camp
Columbia Barracks Hospital some huts where Yellow Fever
patients were taken for treatment and it is very evident
that it was one of these huts that was shown to me in
1906 as where the experiments were made and which were
located to the southwest of the Hospital.

This is apparently where they have marked as the
location of the “False Camp Lazear”.-

The only thing that it is not in accord with my
memory is that you say that on this location was erected
a small temporary tent hospital while I distintly remem-
ber at least two unpainted small wooden one room huts
not unlike some of those shown on your photograph of the
model, which you sent me.

There is no record of there ever having been a bridge
over our track at any point in Marianao nor between Quemados
and La Playa.-

Practically all of our track in the vicinity of the
Military Hospital is through cuttings or on fills and I am
led to believe that the model referred to was made up as a
project and not showing what was actually constructed as
it would appear our tracks are on very flat ground which
cannot be at that point.
In short I do not believe that the bridge ever existed.

Should I obtain any further information I will be
pleased to forward it to you and in the meanwhile should you
desire any specific information that I can obtain for you I
would be pleased to carry out your requests.

closer.seg:
P.S. I am also enclosing plan of Marianao as of 1924
showing the San José estate and Camp Columbia.
R S W
RSW/RA.
